citations.narrative:
At the time of the inspection, when touring the commissary where most of the food for all the animals is stored and
prepared, there were numerous flies throughout the entire area, including inside some of the food containers. There was
evidence of attempts to control pests throughout the facility, including, but not limited to, bug zappers and bait traps. Pests
can negatively affect the health and well-being of the animals by introducing diseases, affect the quality of food/water, and
cause discomfort, among other things. An effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and
mammalian pests shall be established and maintained.
Correct by: July 5, 2024

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
At the time of the inspection, when touring the commissary where most of the food for all the animals is stored and
prepared, there were numerous flies throughout the entire area, including inside some of the food containers. Additionally,
four live, small roaches were found on top of the fresh food inside of the enclosure with the Red Ruffed lemur. There was
evidence of attempts to control pests throughout the facility; including, but not limited to bug zappers and bait traps. Pests
can negatively affect the health and well-being of the animals by introducing diseases, affect the quality of food/water, and
cause discomfort, among other things. An effective program for control of insects, external parasites affecting nonhuman
primates, and birds and mammals that are pests, must be established and maintained to promote the health and well-
being of the animals and reduce contamination by pests in animal areas.
Correct by: July 5, 2024

At the time of the inspection, when touring the commissary where most of the food for all the animals is stored and
prepared, there were numerous flies throughout the entire area, including inside some of the food containers. Additionally,
there was an excessive number of flies located near the end of the staff walkway immediately adjacent to the enclosures
that house the two female ocelots in their night quarters. There was evidence of attempts to control pests throughout the
facility; including, but not limited to bug zappers and bait traps. Pests can negatively affect the health and well-being of the
animals by introducing diseases, affect the quality of food/water, and cause discomfort, among other things. A safe and
effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests shall be established and
maintained.
Correct by: July 5, 2024

While discussing animal losses since the last inspection with the Animal Care Manager, it was revealed on the morning of
April 10, 2023, a Sun Conure – located in the MACAW#3 exhibit – was missing from the enclosure. The manager
explained the Sun Conure laid an egg and was nesting near the perimeter of the enclosure, where feathers were found in
this area, pulled through the fencing, and along the outside of the enclosure in the same area. An Animal Incident Report
was documented by the facility which indicated the cause to be mostly likely due to predation. Primary enclosures that do
not protect the animals contained therein can negatively impact the health, well-being, and safety of the animals. Primary
enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they protect the birds from injury and restrict other animals from
entering the enclosure.
Correct by: July 5, 2024

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.

At the time of the inspection, when touring the commissary where most of the food for all the animals is stored and

Correct by: July 5, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.

narrative:
3.56(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
At the time of the inspection, when touring the commissary where most of the food for all the animals is stored and 
prepared, there were numerous flies throughout the entire area, including inside some of the food containers. There was 
evidence of attempts to control pests throughout the facility, including, but not limited to, bug zappers and bait traps. Pests 
can negatively affect the health and well-being of the animals by introducing diseases, affect the quality of food/water, and 
cause discomfort, among other things. An effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and 
mammalian pests shall be established and maintained. 
 
Correct by: July 5, 2024 
3.84(d) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
At the time of the inspection, when touring the commissary where most of the food for all the animals is stored and 
prepared, there were numerous flies throughout the entire area, including inside some of the food containers. Additionally, 
four live, small roaches were found on top of the fresh food inside of the enclosure with the Red Ruffed lemur. There was 
evidence of attempts to control pests throughout the facility; including, but not limited to bug zappers and bait traps. Pests 
can negatively affect the health and well-being of the animals by introducing diseases, affect the quality of food/water, and 
cause discomfort, among other things. An effective program for control of insects, external parasites affecting nonhuman 
primates, and birds and mammals that are pests, must be established and maintained to promote the health and well-
being of the animals and reduce contamination by pests in animal areas.

3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
At the time of the inspection, when touring the commissary where most of the food for all the animals is stored and 
prepared, there were numerous flies throughout the entire area, including inside some of the food containers. Additionally, 
there was an excessive number of flies located near the end of the staff walkway immediately adjacent to the enclosures

that house the two female ocelots in their night quarters. There was evidence of attempts to control pests throughout the 
facility; including, but not limited to bug zappers and bait traps. Pests can negatively affect the health and well-being of the 
animals by introducing diseases, affect the quality of food/water, and cause discomfort, among other things. A safe and 
effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests shall be established and 
maintained.  
 
Correct by: July 5, 2024 
3.153(a)(1)  Critical
   
Primary enclosures. 
While discussing animal losses since the last inspection with the Animal Care Manager, it was revealed on the morning of 
April 10, 2023, a Sun Conure – located in the MACAW#3 exhibit – was missing from the enclosure. The manager 
explained the Sun Conure laid an egg and was nesting near the perimeter of the enclosure, where feathers were found in 
this area, pulled through the fencing, and along the outside of the enclosure in the same area. An Animal Incident Report 
was documented by the facility which indicated the cause to be mostly likely due to predation. Primary enclosures that do 
not protect the animals contained therein can negatively impact the health, well-being, and safety of the animals. Primary 
enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they protect the birds from injury and restrict other animals from 
entering the enclosure.  
 
Correct by: July 5, 2024 
3.158(d) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
At the time of the inspection, when touring the commissary where most of the food for all the animals is stored and 
prepared, there were numerous flies throughout the entire area, including inside some of the food containers. There was 
evidence of attempts to control pests throughout the facility, including, but not limited to, bug zappers and bait traps. Pests 
can negatively affect the health and well-being of the animals by introducing diseases, affect the quality of food/water, and 
cause discomfort, among other things. A safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian 
and mammalian pests must be established and maintained to promote the health and well-being of the birds and reduce 
contamination by pests in animal areas.  
 
Correct by: July 5, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
